Purpose: Characterizing hierarchical population structure
Specifics: Arlequin allows for a variety of other analyses of diversity
Issues and warnings: Requires a priori assignment of individuals to populations, data formatting is required prior analysis

Purpose: Grouping individuals in spatially consistent clusters maximizing HW equilibrium
Specifics: Takes into account spatial variation, supposed to detect weak structure, framed in R
Issues and warnings: Immigrant alleles are assumed to be found only in new immigrants

Purpose: Grouping individuals in clusters maximizing HW equilibrium and LD between loci
Specifics: Fast (30X than ADMIXTURE)
Issues and warnings: Still slow computation time for very large datasets

Purpose: Grouping individuals in clusters maximizing HW equilibrium and LD between loci
Specifics: User friendly interface. Bayesian inference.
Issues and warnings: Not suited for whole genomes. Requires specific input format. Might be used on a small set of high quality markers for small genomes.

Purpose: Grouping individuals in clusters maximizing HW equilibrium and LD between loci
Specifics: ~100X faster than Structure
Issues and warnings: Approximate inference of the original Structure model

Purpose: Grouping individuals in clusters maximizing HW equilibrium and LD between loci
Specifics: Maximum Likelihood, claimed to be faster than Structure. Can handle sex-linked markers
Issues and warnings: Often slower than its counterparts

Purpose: Chromosome painting, admixture and clustering
Specifics: Estimates time since admixture, fast, set of scripts to facilitate analysis
Issues and warnings: Relies on Structure and fastStructure assumptions. Requires phased data.

Purpose: Chromosome painting
Specifics: Fast, uses HMM to smooth out windows and limit noise due to low confidence ancestry
Issues and warnings: Requires a priori definition of ancestral populations and phased haplotypes

Purpose: Chromosome painting, estimating admixture time and proportions.
Specifics: Can handle several source populations. These populations do not have to be good surrogates of populations that actually mixed.
Issues and warnings: Requires phased data, but performs phasing error correction.

Purpose: Summarizing variance across loci and visualizing inter-individual genetic distance
Specifics: Uses latent factors to correct for drift and position ancient samples in a PCA-like framework.
Issues and warnings: NA

Purpose: Grouping individuals in clusters maximizing HW equilibrium and LD between loci
Specifics: This method explicitly takes into account the age of samples. Useful when analyzing mixtures of modern and ancient samples.
Issues and warnings: Requires a genotype matrix in the eigenstrat format. Primarily tested on human data.

Purpose: Identifies contribution of environment and geographical distance to populations differentiation
Specifics: Less biased than Mantel tests, provides tools for model testing
Issues and warnings: Uses population-level data.

Purpose: Extracting summary statistics from pooled data
Specifics: Explicitely corrects for sampling bias in pooled data. Allows computing tests using an outgroup (MK test, HKA test, Fay and Wu's H) and characterizing coding mutations.
Issues and warnings: Mostly limited to summary statistics, but more complete than Popoolation.

Purpose: Extracting summary statistics from pooled data
Specifics: Explicitely corrects for sampling bias in pooled data. Can be used to detect TE polymorphisms.
Issues and warnings: Mostly limited to a few summary statistics. A pipeline dedicated to TE detection is also available
Reference: (Kofler, Orozco-terWengel, et al., 2011; Kofler, Pandey, et al., 2011)

Purpose: Computing summary statistics based on AFS and LD along genomes
Specifics: Accepts VCF and GFF/GFT files, efficient and fast. Tests for admixture available (ABBA BABA test). Includes basic coalescence simulations (ms and msms)
Issues and warnings: Mostly limited to summary statistics (but coalescent simulations are possible). No built-in SNP calling module

Purpose: Computing summary statistics based on AFS and LD along genomes
Specifics: Able to process BAM files, built-in procedures for data filtering, admixture analysis. Suited for low-depth data. Includes a suite of methods to estimate relatedness (NGSRelate).
Issues and warnings: Mostly limited to summary statistics. Tutorials not always up-to-date.

Purpose: Computing summary statistics based on AFS and LD along genomes
Specifics: Can output AFS for further analysis in fastsimcoal2
Issues and warnings: Slower than PopGenome, requires a specific format and file conversion.

Purpose: Computing summary statistics based on AFS and LD along genomes
Specifics: Fast. VCFTOOLS can also be used for SNP filtering
Issues and warnings: Less summary statistics than POPGenome

Purpose: Low depth sequencing/ancient samples analsis
Specifics: Particularly suited for analyzing ancient samples. Includes sets of tools to call variants, estimate post-mortem damage, inbreeding, genetic diversity. Produces the input file for PSMC (demography from a single diploid genome)
Issues and warnings: Better used in combination with GATK pipelines. Still in development

Purpose: Visualizing a matrix of pairwise differentiation statistics as a tree
Specifics: Can be used for pooled datasets, several statistics can be used
Issues and warnings: Differentiation measures alone do not necessarily retrieve the actual history of populations

Purpose: Estimating barriers to gene flow in a spatial context
Specifics: Estimates pairwise relatedness between all samples, and compares it to isolation-by-distance expectations to identify barriers to gene flow and corridors of higher connectivity. Can handle both haploid and diploid data
Issues and warnings: Requires to convert VCF file into PLINK binary format. Estimates effective migration rates (does not disantangle migration rates and effective population sizes). Setting parameters for the MCMC chain requires some trial-and-error

Purpose: Estimating barriers to gene flow in a spatio-temporal context
Specifics: Expands on EEMS, but takes into account the phase to reconstruct past changes in connectivity. Can disentantle migration rates and effective population sizes (unlike EEMS)
Issues and warnings: Relies on identity-by-descent tracks, requiring phasing (for example using BEAGLE). A pipeline to obtain IBD tracks is available, with a few details here: https://github.com/halasadi/ibd_data_pipeline/issues/1

Purpose: Grouping individuals in clusters maximizing HW equilibrium and LD between loci
Specifics: Incorporates geographic information of samples. Can run genome scans of selection based on contrasting ancestral and modern allele frequencies.
Issues and warnings: Importing data requires using conversion tools found in the LEA suite

Purpose: Summarizing variance across loci and visualizing inter-individual genetic distance
Specifics: Fast. Can use VCF files as an input
Issues and warnings: Requires careful interpretation (Jombard et al. 2009)

Purpose: Summarizing variance across loci and visualizing inter-individual genetic distance
Specifics: Fast. Can use VCF files as an input
Issues and warnings: Requires careful interpretation (Jombard et al. 2009)

Purpose: Maximizes divergence between groups identified by PCA
Specifics: Fast. Less sensitive to HWE assumptions. Claims to be more efficient than Structure
Issues and warnings: Requires careful interpretation (Jombard et al. 2009)

Purpose: Spatially explicit model to assess population structure
Specifics: Spatially explicit and able to detect cryptic structure. Fast.
Issues and warnings: Does not take into account HW equilibrium or LD

Purpose: Chromosome painting, relatedness
Specifics: LAMP also allows for association and pedigree analyses
Issues and warnings: Identifies local ancestry in windows (source of noise), requires phased data

Purpose: Estimating inbreeding and relatedness
Specifics: Allows studying identity by descent and by state. PLINK is a multi-purpose tool, facilitating data analysis within the same software
Issues and warnings: NA

Purpose: Estimating inbreeding and relatedness
Specifics: Computes unadjusted Ajk and kinship coefficient
Issues and warnings: NA

Purpose: Estimating inbreeding and relatedness, multivariate analysis
Specifics: Mendelian error checking, testing family structure, highly accurate kinship coefficient, association analysis, population structure inference
Issues and warnings: Kinship coefficient also computed in VCFTOOLS

Purpose: Pedigree inference from SNPs
Specifics: Robust even with high error rates (e.g. low-depth sequencing). Can handle haplo-diploids systems (e.g. ants). Multi-threaded.
Issues and warnings: Can only simulate genotypes with the Windows version.

Purpose: Pedigree inference from SNPs
Specifics: Can be applied to large pedigrees (>1000 individuals). Accomodates unknown birth times.
Issues and warnings: Handles hundreds of SNPs. For whole-genome data, preliminary filtering and LD-pruning may be recommended. Efficient with ~100 SNPs.

Purpose: Estimating variation in recombination rates along a genome
Specifics: Handles unphased and missing data, underlying model can be used for organisms such as viruses or bacteria
Issues and warnings: Limited to 300 sequences, specific format (not VCF), model for recombination hotspots based on human data

Purpose: Identifying recombination hotspots
Specifics: Specifically designed for detecting recombination hotspots
Issues and warnings: Requires data to be phased, working with LDHat

Purpose: Recombination from a single diploid genome
Specifics: No phasing needed. Accepts VCF files as input.
Issues and warnings: Introgression and demographic misspecification may bias results. No detailed tutorial

Purpose: Estimating variation in recombination rates along a genome
Specifics: Higher accuracy than LDHat
Issues and warnings: Requires phased data. Does not handle VCF, only fasta and fastq formats. Requires dividing the genome in short segments to be analysed in parallel.
